ref: 12666 śyāmā f. ʻ a kind of plant (used for curing leprosy) ʼ Paipp., śāmāˊ -- f. ŚaunakaAV. [Cf. śyāmāˊka -- ]
Pa. sāmā -- f. ʻ a medicinal plant ʼ (= piyaṅgu -- which means ʻ a medicinal plant ʼ and ʻ the millet Panicum italicum ʼ);
K. hāma f. ʻ the fodder grass
Mth. sām ʻ a kind of autumn millet ʼ.
